docs.lead_paragraph: The gig economy is reshaping the work world for many Americans. It is also reshaping tax season. Here is what the newly self-employed need to know.

headline.main: Tax Tips for Those Who Make Money in the Gig Economy

docs.lead_paragraph: A Texas doctor has been found guilty of bilking $10 million from health insurance companies and the U.S. government through fraud, including being paid for attending surgeries while he was actually on his private jet, U.S. prosecutors said on Friday.

headline.main: Texas Doctor Found Guilty of Bilking Insurers, Government of $10 Million
headline.print_headline: Texas Doctor Found Guilty of Bilking Insurers, Government of $10 Million

docs.snippet: A Texas doctor has been found guilty of bilking $10 million from health insurance companies and the U.S. government through fraud, including being paid for attending surgeries while he was actually on his private jet, U.S. prosecutors said on Friday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Lawmakers in Connecticut are again trying to bar people charged with murder or manslaughter but found not guilty by reason of insanity from benefiting from the victims' deaths, including inheriting their assets and reaping life insurance windfalls.

headline.main: Suspects Found Insane Couldn't Profit From Murder Under Bill
headline.print_headline: Suspects Found Insane Couldn't Profit From Murder Under Bill

docs.lead_paragraph: One way or another, the 11th Republican presidential debate was pretty much all about Donald Trump — his shifts on positions, the gaps in his policies, his defunct university, his character and some rather personal chatter about the man.

docs.lead_paragraph: As Republican leaders desperately seek ways to derail the presidential campaign of billionaire Donald Trump, many of the party's 31 state governors are staying out of the fray.

docs.lead_paragraph: Japan Post Holdings Co CEO Taizo Nishimuro is set to resign in coming weeks, two people with direct knowledge of the matter said on Friday, amid speculation over his health following his hospitalization nearly a month ago.    The company has started a search for his successor, with potential candidates including top managers from other companies, said the sources, who were not authorized to discuss the matter publicly.

headline.main: Japan Post CEO Nishimuro to Step Down Amid Health Concerns: Sources
headline.print_headline: Japan Post CEO Nishimuro to Step Down Amid Health Concerns: Sources

docs.lead_paragraph: Four decades ago, political leaders declared war on lead, citing evidence of its pernicious impact on young brains. But the crusade remains unfinished.

headline.main: Flint Is in the News, but Lead Poisoning Is Even Worse in Cleveland
headline.print_headline: Beyond Flint, Lead Poisoning Persists Despite Decades-Old Fight

docs.abstract: Drinking water scandal in Flint, Mich, highlights larger issue of lead poisoning, which affects children in Cleveland and many other cities nationwide, mostly because four-decades-long public health crusade on lead paint has not been efficacious; 37 million homes and apartments, many of which are in mostly poor neighborhoods, still have lead paint, and 23 million have potentially hazardous levels, four million of those with children.
docs.snippet: Four decades ago, political leaders declared war on lead, citing evidence of its pernicious impact on young brains. But the crusade remains unfinished.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Living out of a Ford Explorer after losing his home, an unemployed chemist changes his own trajectory while stirring the altruistic impulses of some who were wary of him.

headline.main: Making the Journey From Menace to Neighbor, All on One Brooklyn Block
headline.print_headline: Living in S.U.V., Transformed From a Menace to a Neighbor

docs.abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column relates odyssey of unemployed chemist Gene, who sleeps in his Ford Explorer in Park Slope, Brooklyn, and is now viewed as neighbor rather than menace by residents; Gene, who received money and aid from those living on the block, is now on disability insurance and plans to move to Wisconsin.
docs.snippet: Living out of a Ford Explorer after losing his home, an unemployed chemist changes his own trajectory while stirring the altruistic impulses of some who were wary of him.
